Cases reported from Village Edavaka, FHC Edavaka Main Centre, Mananthavadi, District Wayanad. Five Serum samples collected and sent to NIV Alapuzha where all samples tested IgM positive for measles. Cases reported from Village Khairai, Block Dhata with symptoms of fever with rashes. Five blood samples were tested out of which all found positive for Measles by IgM ELISA. District & block RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education given through community sensitization meeting regarding vaccination coverage.

Cases reported from Village Lalauli, Block- Asothar with symptoms of fever with rashes. Six blood samples tested by IgM tested out of which four samples found positive for Measles. District & block RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education given through community sensitization meeting regarding vaccination coverage.

Cases reported from UHC Dolakpara and UHC Gandhigram, Junagadh Corporation area with fever and rash. Five blood sample, urine and nasopharyngeal samples were taken and sent to designated laboratory and all found IgM positive for measles. District RRT investigated the outbreak, house to house fever survey done in the affected area. Health education given regarding hygiene maintenance. Vitamin A and MR vaccination for children carried out. Team also started OPD based treatment at places by local health team.

Cases reported with fever and rash to UHC area, Ranitalav and Saiyedpura, Ward Vankibordi in Surat Municipal area. Six serum sample sent to Microbiology Laboratory of B. J. Medical Collage, Ahmedabad, where five tested positive for measles by IgM antibody testing. Eight cases are vaccinated as per age, one case not eligible for vaccination as per age whereas three cases were unvaccinated as per age. Poor vaccination in the area may have contributed to spreading of infection. Index case Khadija Mo. Javed Qureshi, 4.5 years old female, partially vaccinated, was reported by Private Pediatrician Dr. Zainul Gagan. District RRT investigate the outbreak, health education was imparted. Surveillance for more cases and Immunization sessions were conducted, preparation of line list of due beneficiaries of MR-1 & MR-2, meeting with local leaders & private practitioners of UHC and continued surveillance and RI sessions in affected area.

Cases reported from Village Saraibhawsingh, Block Suriyawan with symptoms of fever and rashes. Five blood samples tested, out of which two found positive for Measles by IgM. District & block RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education given and vaccination drive was conducted.

Cases reported from Village Bommanayakanahalli and Village Madijalli under PHC/CHC Kowshika and PHC/CHC Salagme respectively, District Hassan. Cases presented with fever, headache and rashes. 17 blood and three throat samples were collected and sent to VRDL HIMS, Hassan. Of these, two samples were found positive for Rubella by IgM ELISA and all five samples were found positive for Measles by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey was done. The most affected age group was 0-5 years followed by 6-10 years. Immunisation status of children in all the adjoining areas including the surrrounding villages was checked. All affected children were found to be vaccinated. Children with missed doses were administered vaccine on a mission mode. Cases were isolated and were provided Vitamin A supplementation. Health education was given on the importance of immunization.

Cases reported from village Mahajee Paswan, Tola Gyaspur with complaints of fever with rash. Five blood samples were sent to AIIMS, Patna where all tested IgM positive for measles. Cases reported from Health facility-Narayanpur, District Jamtara. Cases presented with fever and rashes. Blood samples were sent to RIMS Microbiology Lab, Ranchi, Jharkhand. Of these, two cases were found positive for Measles by IgM ELISA and one sample was found positive for Rubella by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. During the epidemiological survey, it was found that the positive cases were not vaccinated with MR vaccine at the prescribed time. Hence, instructions were given to provide MR vaccine by setting up special vaccination camps. Health education was imparted on the importance of immunization.

Cases were reported from Aurangabad Urban area. They presented with fever with rashes. Six blood samples were sent to AIIMS, Patna. Of these, three were found positive for Measles by IgM ELISA. Vitamin A supplementation was given. Health education was given on the importance of immunization.

Cases were reported from Aurangabad Urban area. They presented with fever with rashes. Six blood samples were sent to AIIMS, Patna. Of these, three were found positive for Measles by IgM ELISA. Vitamin A supplementation was given. Health education was given on the importance of immunization.

Cases reported from CHC Azhikode, PP Unit DH Kannur, Division 43, Kannur Corporation, District Kannur. They presented with fever with rashes. Cases reported from Village Shankarpur, PHC Kuleth, Block Barai, District Gwalior. Cases presented with fever and rashes. Four blood samples were sent to Gandhi Medical College, Bhopal. Of these, three samples were found positive for Measles by IgM ELISA. Age group of the affected cases were between 7 months to 5 years. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases reported from Late Bapusaheb Kawade Patil Disp Koregaon Park, District Pune. They presented with fever, cough, coryza, red eyes, rashes and loose stools. Two throat swab samples and four blood samples were sent for lab analysis to Haffkin Labo, Mumbai. All the samples were found positive for Measles by IgM ELISA. All the cases were below 10 years. Of the affected cases, only one was known to be vaccinated, rest were unvaccinated or status unknown. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey for all suspected cases were done. Follow up of suspected cases and their contacts was done on periodic basis. Children with unvaccinated statuses were identified and vaccinated. Special focus was given on malnourished children for vaccination and Vitamin A supplementation was done. Extra vaccination campaign was conducted in the outbreak areas to cover all population. Health education through posters and banners displayed at public places were done to increase awareness among the community regarding Measles.

Of the affected cases, only one was known to be vaccinated, rest were unvaccinated or status unknown. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey for all suspected cases were done. Follow up of suspected cases and their contacts was done on periodic basis. Children with unvaccinated statuses were identified and vaccinated. Special focus was given on malnourished children for vaccination and Vitamin A supplementation was done. Extra vaccination campaign was conducted in the outbreak areas to cover all population. Health education through posters and banners displayed at public places were done to increase awareness among the community regarding Measles.

Cases reported from Village Kotekar, PHC/CHC Kotekar/ Natekar, Block Mangalore, District Dakshina Kannada. Of these, eight blood samples were found positive for Measles and one sample positive for Rubella by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases reported from from Village Nanjegowdanakopplu, PHC Basaralu, Taluk Mandya, District Mandya. Cases presented with fever with rash. Five blood samples were collected and sent to NIV Bengaluru and all were found positive for Measles by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey was done. Vitamin A supplementation was given to all suspected cases. Isolation of affected cases was advised and to maintain personal hygiene. Post outbreak vaccination camp was conducted, seven children were vaccinated. Most of the cases belonged to 5-9 years age group followed by 10-15 years. Health education was given on the importance of immunization.

Cases reported from Village/PHC/CHC Davangere Urban, Taluk Davangere, District Davangere. They presented with fever with rash. Eleven serum samples collected and sent to NIV Pune. Most of the cases belonged to 6-10 years age followed by less than 5 years age group. Health education was given on the importance of immunization.

The most commonly affected age was 8 years. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Vitamin A was given to the affected cases.

Two cases of fever with rash were reported from Rajouri Garden, West Delhi district. Dilkash Rajal s/o Mohd. Zafir Ansari age 4.9 years was notified by GGSGH on 12.10.2022, he was unimmunized and had travel history to Uttar Pradesh 17 days before rash onset. Another 4 yr old, neighbor of first case, with unknown vaccination status and no travel history reported with similar symptoms. Blood samples of both tested IgM positive for measles. Regular follow up of the cases was carried out by DIO & MOIC MCW Khayala. House to House survey was done in the area by ANM and ASHA teams. Vitamin A supplementation was carried out.

Cases reported from Village Pookkottur, SC Mundithodika, SC Pullara, MC Pookkottur, Block Pookkottur, District Malappuram. Ten samples tested positive for PCR Measles in State PH Lab Trivandrum. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from SC Main Centre Malappuram Municipality, UPHC Malappuram, Block Pookkottur, District Malappuram. Eleven samples collected and tested positive for measles PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Area VPO Jattal, Shiv nagar and ara azad nagar Panipat, PHC/CH Kawi/Madlauda, District Panipat with fever and rashes. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Symptomatic treatment was given. Vitamin A prophylaxis given to suspected.

Cases reported from Area VPO Jattal, Shiv nagar and ara azad nagar Panipat, PHC/CH Kawi/Madlauda, District Panipat with fever and rashes. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Symptomatic treatment was given. Vitamin A prophylaxis given to suspected.

Cases reported from Nava Nagar UHC, South East Zone of Surat Municipal Corporation, Surat with fever and rash. Index Case was Fatema Ahmad Asgar Shaikh, 03 Years 09 Months/Female. As per preliminary investigation fifteen cases of Measles reported in which 03 cases are Vaccinated as per Age and for rest cases vaccination status is unknown, so poor vaccination in area may contribute in spreading of Infection & play major part. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Surveillance for more cases & Immunization Session was conducted. Mobilization by Local leaders during RI Sessions. IEC done by involvement of local leaders, Maulana of Masjids & Private practioners, miking done by Maulana at Masjid during Namaz, message was shared in Gujarati and Hindi Language.

Cases reported from AGMC-Vijayanagar health Centre in Aurangabad Municipal Corporation area with maculopapular rash and fever. Seven blood samples have been sent to NIV, Mumbai unit for examination where four samples were found measles positive. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Rapid Fever Survey was conducted. Special Isolation Ward has been set up for the treatment of the measles patients, special vaccination drive conducted in the affected areas.

Cases reported from Mudiya Zila Mukhayalaya (9/1) and Village Faridpur, Block Damkihoda (10/1). District RRT visited the affected area. All susceptible children immunized. All cases isolated and treated symptomatically. Daily surveillance and monitoring being done in the affected areas. IEC activities undertaken regarding isolation of cases and personal protection measures.

Cases reported among school children of Mahila Samabaya Hostel, in PHC Deviyar Colony area, Panchayat and Block Adimali. Medical officer and team visited the school hostel. Health education given regarding early diagnosis, isolation and treatment of cases. Immunization status is being assessed.

Outbreak reported from neighboring villages of Erendra, Biswanathpur, Kalasandhapur, Erendra GP, Adapada PHC. All cases are children (9 months- 18 yrs age-group), presented with symptoms of fever, running nose and rash, and were clinically diagnosed as measles. District RRT with Block level epidemic response team investigated the outbreak and took necessary steps to control the outbreak in the affected areas. Symptomatic treatment given to all affected children. Vitamin A solution administered to all affected children. Micro plan prepared along with Block team for mass measles vaccination coverage of all children in age-group of 9 months to 5 years in the affected area and adjoining unaffected areas, irrespective of the immunization status.

Cases reported from CHC Meppady (Erattukundu colony under Mundakal sub centre). Cases diagnosed clinically. Field survey conducted for new cases. Medical camps and IEC activities conducted in the school where affected children were studying. Vitamin A given to all cases. Immunization camp arranged. Serum sample collected and sent to lab for confirmation. Health education given to public and all school children.

Cases reported from Lamberdharpuwra, Baroli, CHC Belser. Ring immunization done. Cases treated symptomatically. IEC activities undertaken and awareness programmes conducted. Health education given regarding personal hygiene and isolation of cases.
Cases reported from village Anandapur, CHC Nawab Ganj. All cases cure and conservative treatment given daily surveillance and monitoring done.

Outbreak reported from Village Barobisha, School Jawahar Navodya Vidyalaya, PHC Barobisha, Block Kumargram. Cases presented with fever with rash. Cluster of cases in the School hostel. All the cases are in the age-group of 12 - 16 years. District RRT visited the affected area. Sera samples collected for testing for measles IgM antibodies in the Institute of Serology, Kolkata. Symptomatic treatment given along with Vitamin  A as per guidelines issued by Swasthya Bhawan. IEC activities going on.

Cases reported from Village Minnathur, Sub Centre Minnathur, PHC Andakulam, Block Kunnandarkovli. Dist. RRT visited, house-to-house survey done for new cases. Ring immunization done and Vitamin-A prophylaxis given. Five sera samples sent to Chennai; lab result awaited.

Outbreak reported from Jhawar, Luni (Salawas), PHC Jhawar affecting children of same village of 3 different Dhanis (Baniya Nada, Sharan Nagar, Kumariya Nada) with symptoms of fever with rash. All are in the age group of 3 - 8 years. Out of 5, four are vaccinated and vaccination status of one is unknown. Daily survey done, and ring immunization and vitamin A supplement given to all susceptible children in affected area. Immunization survey being done. Health education given.

Cases reported from Dolta, Kalanada, Punrwas Coloni Panwar II, Panwar Mod. District RRT visited the affected areas. One child with measles had come from neighboring Juniya village. Malnutrition and unhygienic conditions prevalent in the affected village. All cases were given symtomatic treatment and vitamin A solution. House to house survey done for new fever cases with rash.

Cases reported from Govt. Tribal Boys Hostel, Denducomp, Deviculom Revenue Block, PHC Kanthalloor, Sub Centre Denducomp. Medical Officer and team visited the hostel and isolated the infected people. Measles vaccination campaign conducted for unimmunized children.

Cases with fever and rash reported from Village Khadat, PHC Mahudi, Block Mansa. Vitamin-A prophylaxis given to all susceptibles and all cases treated symptomatically. Active surveillance being done to find new cases.

Cases reported from villages Karda Fala, Somawat nal, subcentre Kitkawat, PHC Pipli B, Block Kherwara. Poor immunization status and irregular visit of health workers found in the area on investigation. Cases treated symptomatically. Sera samples collected and sent to Ahmadabad for lab analysis; result awaited. House to house survey done for new cases. Immunization of susceptible children done and Vitamin  A prophylaxis given.

Cases reported from Village Dumuriguda, GP-Ekamba, CHC Rabanaguda, Block Jeypore. The CHC Medical Officers visited the area and treated cases symptomatically. Immunization status of the children in the affected area and neighboring villages being assessed by health workers. Vitamin-A prophylaxis given to all susceptible children. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Cases reported from Ikauna, Narayanjot. District RRT visited the affected area. Measles vaccination and Vitamin  A prophylaxis given to all susceptible children. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Outbreak reported from Chinnareddy Colony, Chinthalacheruvu sub centre, PHC Nuzendla. 4 sera samples tested IgM positive for measles. Vitamin-A solution given to all cases and susceptible children. Measles vaccination done for all unaffected children in the affected area.

Cases reported from village Jisori, PHC Kharkhoda, Block Kharkhoda. District RRT visited the affected area. All susceptible children immunized and all cases treated symptomatically. Daily surveillance being done in affected area. IEC activities undertaken regarding isolation of cases and personal protection measures.

Cases of measles diagnosed clinically reported from Village Guanapada, PHC Mulwad, Taluka Trimbak. District RRT investigated outbreak. Active survey done for new cases in the community. Measles vaccination done among unimmunised children between 6 month to 5 yrs, and Vitamin-A solution also administered. Health education given advising proper isolation of the cases and to maintain proper hygiene. ANM advised to undertake measles immunization of all children in community. Sera samples collected for serology; result awaited.

Outbreak reported from villages Kawai, Bailara, Raysees, Khedi Devi Singh, Tah Nadwai. Medical team sent to the affected villages. Immunization coverage survey conducted in affected villages found to be low. Five sera samples sent for laboratory confirmation to B.J Medical College, Ahmedabad. Ring immunization conducted and Vitamin-A solution also given to all susceptible children. IEC activities conducted.

Cases reported from Village Rathari, Sub Centre Bormata, PHC Chikhli, Block Simalwara. Five sera samples sent to Vijay Medical College, Ahmadabad (Gujarat); result is awaited. Immunization status being assessed. House to house survey and treatment of cases done.

Outbreak reported from Nagar Ghata, PHC Marena, Block Rajakhera. All cases treated symptomatically and Vitamin-A given to all susceptible children. Health education given regarding isolation of cases.

Cases reported from Sardar Sahar. Sera sample collected from five cases sent to Ahmedabad for testing; result awaited. Medical teams deployed in affected area to treat cases and to conduct house to house survey. Vitamin  A given to the cases (two doses) and other susceptible children (one dose). The immunization status of cases unknown. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Village Purba Salbari and Volka, PHC Barobisha, Block Kumargram. All cases presented with symptoms of fever, acute respiratory infection and rash. Outbreak investigated by RRT. Clustering of cases found. Out of five sera samples tested at the Institute of Serology, three found positive for Measles IgM antibodies and two found positive for Rubella IgM antibodies. Symptomatic treatment of cases and administration of Vitamin-A done. IEC activities undertaken.

Cases reported from Village Bharthana, Karjan Urban PHC Choranda, Handod, Block Karjan. Surveillance of affected area done for new cases. Sera samples collected and sent to Ahmedabad Medical College for lab analysis; result awaited. Measles vaccination and Vitamin-A prophylaxis given to susceptible children. Health education imparted regarding isolation of cases.

Cases reported from Village Vati, PHC Losing, Block Badgaon. Visit by ANM to the village and sub centre found to be irregular which could be the reason for poor immunization status in the area. House to house surveillance done for new cases. Standard cases management followed. Vitamin-A prophylaxis and measles vaccination given to all susceptible children.

Outbreak occurred at villages Masak, Seinthad, Hatad and Bhangar, under Block Chakarata. All cases clinically diagnosed as measles There is no history of measles vaccination of these children. The concerned health workers instructed to get all susceptible children of the affected area immunized. All cases treated in the CHC and the nearby sub-district hospital. IEC activities undertaken regarding importance of immunization in children.

Cases reported from village Kavalkarapalayam, PHC Perugamani. All cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin-A given to affected and susceptible children. Active house to house search done and health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases with fever and rash reported from PHC Kumbidi, Block Chalissery. District RRT visited the affected area. All cases treated symptomatically and isolated. Active house to house search done and health education given to public.

Cases with rashes and fever were reported from Maziyali and Nainigaon villages under CHC Naugaon. District RRT visited the area and treated all cases. Immunization status being assessed in the area. IEC regarding immunization and early treatment was done.

Cases reported from villages Rasula, Navi basti, Nawat pur, Jamella pur and Gulshan nagar, under PHC Nawab Ganj. Cases presented with maculopapular rash and fever. Conservative treatment given and health education given.

Cases with fever and rash clinically diagnosed as measles were reported from Gram Bahadurpur, Rajbhar Basti. District RRT visited affected village. Measles vaccination done and Vitamin -A solution distributed to susceptible children in the affected area. Health education given regarding isolation of cases and hygienic practices.

Cases reported from village and PHC Mawai. District RRT visited the affected area and treated cases. Immunisation status of the underfives being estimated. Vit A prophylaxis given to the cases. IEC activities undertaken regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Cases reported from village Regwa, sub center Gadaipur, PHC Nakhaha. District RRT visited the affected area. Measles vaccination and distribution of Vitamin  A done to all susceptible children. Health education given to villagers regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Cases reported from Sharawasti HP Rani Chaudey Purwa Gulra. District RRT visited the affected area and investigation done. Measles vaccination and distribution of Vitamin  A done to all susceptible children. Health education given to villagers regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Cases with symptoms of maculopapular rash with fever and coryza were reported from village Sareli, PHC/Block Usawan. District RRT visited the affected area. Health education given to villagers regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Outbreak of fever with rash reported from village Madhai, Block Rajakhera, Ganga KaPura, Kassautikhera, Block Bari, Bhagirath Ka Pura, Block Rajakhera, Bari, Dholpu. Most of the patients have been immunized with Measles vaccine. Five blood samples were taken and sent to Ahmedabad; result awaited. Vitamin  A and symptomatic treatment given to all cases. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases. Active surveillance for new cases done in affected and neighboring villages.

Outbreak reported from Purba Bangaon, PHC Goagaon, among children below 10 yrs of age presenting with fever and rash. District RRT visited and investigated the cases. Active case search done. Vaccination status of all children below 10 years assessed; 95% children were not vaccinated for measles. Measles vaccination and Vitamin-A given to all susceptible children. Health education given regarding isolation and earlt treatment of cases.

Cases reported from Chilkapatti area of village Mandal-Tola, Pipra CHC. Medical Officer from CHC investigated, immunized all children up to 5 years and prophylactic dose of vit A given. Cases treated symptomatically. Health awareness with regards to measles generated. One child had high fever with rash, treated by traditional healers, not brought to CHC , died.

Cases reported from Village Nawpurwa, Purwa, Shahpur Bazar Khas, Sub Center Purwa, H/o Umari Bagamganj, CHC Balser, Colonelganj. District RRT visited the affected area and investigation done. Vaccination of Measles distribution of vitamin A. Health education given.
Cases reported from PHC Mawai. District RRT visited the affected area and investigation done. Vaccination of Measles and distribution of vitamin A done. Health education given.

Outbreak occurred in village Gora Chiraiya, BPHC Rampura. District RRT investigated. Cases treated symptomatically. prophylactic dose of Vit A given. Ring immunization being contemplated. Health education given regarding personal protection measures, and isolation and early treatment of cases.

Outbreak reported from Kujari Mamdhani Chowk in the outskirts of Araria. Medical team from PHC visited; treated cases symptomatically. Prophylactic dose of Vit A given. Ring immunization status of under five children being assessed. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases, and personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Subarnamanjari village, Dukura CHC. Health staff of CHC treated all cases symptomatically. Vitamin A given to all susceptible children. IEC activities undertaken regarding early treatment and isolation of cases. Immunisation status being ascertained.

Cases reported from village Kedar Purwa, PHC Samgara. Medical team visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. All cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin- A given to all susceptible children. IEC activities conducted regarding isolation and early treatment of cases. Immunization status of under five children being ascertained.

Cases reported from Pakhanpura, Block Bhanwarkol, CHC Godour. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Preventive and control measures undertaken by the CHC/PHC level medical team. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.
Cases reported from North Eastern Hills University, Mawkynroh, Umshing. All cases treated and recovered after symptomatic treatment. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Beni Tola (Bharhaul), HSC Bariyawa (Nabinagar). District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. All susceptible children given measles vaccination and Vitamin-A prophylaxis. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Outbreak reported from Gasabad, PHC Hinotakala, CHC Hatta. District RRT team visited the village. All cases treated symptomatically. All susceptible children were given Measles vaccination and Vitamin-A solution. Health staff instructed to keep strict vigilance of affected area and surrounding area.

Cases of fever and rash, clinically diagnosed as measles, reported from adjacent villages of Bothpura, Chokipura, Viparpur, Sarmathura and Piphera. All cases were given symptomatic treatment and Vitamin-A prophylaxis. Active surveillance done in adjoining villages. Health education given regarding personal protection measures and early treatment of cases.

Cases reported from Pakhanpura, Block Bhanwarkol, Raksha, CHC Godour, PHC Bhadoura. District RRT visited and investigated the affected area. Treatment given to all cases. Vitamin-A solution given to all cases and contacts. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village Gram Titalkiya PHC Faeth Gani West, Gram Baghi CHC Nawab Ganj and Gram Najeka Kala PHC Ehergarh. District RRT visited and investigated the affected area. Treatment given to all cases. Vitamin-A solution given to all cases and contacts.

Cases occurred in Gyaspur village, PHC Maulinagar, Block Maner. Block medical officer investigated the outbreak and cases were treated symptomatically by medical team. 6 cases are less than 10 yrs of age; and another 6 cases are in 11-16 yrs age group. Sera samples sent to NCDC for analysis; result awaited. Active surveillance going on to detect new cases. Vitamin A prophylaxis given to all susceptible children. Ring immunization with measles vaccination done. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Cases reported from Village Kasturiya, CHC Handia, Block Handia. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Measles immunization to all under five children being contemplated and vitamin -A prophylaxis given to all susceptible children. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Zariya Khurd, SHC Marora Khals, Block Pohari. District RRT investigated; taken preventive and curative measures. Ring immunization undertaken among children of 6 months to 5 year of age groups. Prophylactic Vitamin A supplementation given. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Cases reported from Village Jharkai, Tahsil Nadwal due to weak IEC and immunization. Block level RRT visited the affected area. Ring survey conducted in affected village. Vitamin-A solution given to children between 1-12 yrs of age and 17 children immunized with measles vaccine. One death occurred due to post- measles bronchopneumonia. Health education given to the villagers.

Outbreak reported from Village Mangrol, Marholi, Saipau. 35 new cases were found from different area under supervision of RCHO, Dholpur. All cases were given Symptomatic treatment and vitamin -A. Health education given to villagers. Active surveillance being done in the affected as well as near by village.

Cases reported from Village Maharajpura, Block Badagaon. All cases presenting with symptoms of fever and rash were children in the age-group of 2-6 yrs who were already vaccinated. Cases treated symptomatically and advised isolation at home.

Cases with fever and rash reported from Vill Narasinghguda, Malichema, Outdora under GP Murkar, Block/CHC Dasamantpur. Block medical team visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. All cases given treatment and advised isolation. Vitamin-A prophylaxis given to all susceptible children. Health education given.

Cases with fever and rash reported from a single family of village Ramsingh Pura, PHC Saket, Block Rajgarh. District RRT visited and investigated the affected area. Measles vaccination and vitamin A given to all children, and all sick children treated. Active surveillance done in the affected village. IEC activities undertaken regarding early treatment and isolation of cases.

Cases with fever and rash, clinically diagnosed as Measles, reported from Mangalbaria PHC. All cases treated symptomatically by PHC Medical Officer and advised isolation at home. Vitamin A prophylaxis given to all susceptible children. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Village Member Chuk, PHC Bijoypur BPHC Jonai. All cases are children in the age-group pf 3-12 years and presented with symptoms of fever, cough and rash. PHC Medical officer visited the affected village and organized medical camp to treat cases. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection measures.

Cases of fever and rash reported from Gokulpura, Nayka PHC, Nadiyad Block. Medical team visited the affected area. Vitamin  A solution given to all susceptible children. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Cases presented with symptoms of fever and rash clinically suggestive of measles from Palsdar village (Ashram Shala), subcenter Zodga-2, PHC Chikhalohal, Taluka Malegaon. Measles vaccination given to all unimmunized children between 6 months to 5 years of age, along with Vit. A. Health education given advising proper isolation of cases and to maintain proper hygiene. ANM advised to undertake regular immunization drive in community.

Cases reported from Village Jogiyan Ka Pura (9 cases), Khumakapura (4 cases), Block Gohad, and from Sukhvasi ka pura PHC Sihunda, Block Bhind (9 cases). District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. All cases treated symptomatically and IEC activities undertaken regarding immunization.

Cases with fever and rash reported from CHC Tandiyawan Block BelhaiPurwa. District RRT visited and investigated the affected area. Measles vaccination given and Vitamin -A solution administered to all susceptible children in and around the affected village. Health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases and personal protection measures for family members.

Cases of fever, conjunctivitis and rash, clinically diagnosed as Measles, in the age-group of 511 yrs reported from Village Tanakhala, subcentre Rampura, PHC Bahadarpur, Block Sankheda. Five sera samples taken for lab test; result awaited. Active surveillance done. Vitamin -A given to suspected cases and symptomatic treatment given to all cases. IEC activities carried out.

Cases of fever and rash reported from Hanspura, CHC Saipou. No travel history found. All cases are children below 10 years of age. All cases were given symptomatic treatment. Cases clinically diagnosed as measles were reported from Village Baghpura, Block Bagh. All cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin-A supplementation given to all susceptible children in the affected village. IEC activities undertaken regarding measles immunization, proper nutrition and early treatment of cases.

Cases with fever and rash reported from Village Gargatu Shani, SC Barai, Block Badarwas. All cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin-A supplementation given to all susceptible children in the affected village. IEC activities undertaken regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Cases with fever and rash reported from Village Khapa Sector, Magardha, Block Bijadandi. Cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin-A supplementation given to all susceptible children in the affected village. IEC activities undertaken regarding proper nutrition and early treatment of cases.

All cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin-A supplementation given to all susceptible children in age-group of 9 months to 5 years. Active case search done in all the affected villages. IEC activities undertaken regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Cases with fever and rash, clinically diagnosed as measles reported from Village Karaikundu, PHC Uluppagudi under Block Natham. Active surveillance done and measles vaccination given to all unimmunized children. IEC activities undertaken regarding isolation and treatment of cases.

Cases with fever and rash reported from PHC Rajamadam, Block Pattukottai. Cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin-A supplementation given to all susceptible children in the affected village. Cases reported from Village Mekha and Machwara, PHC Dhamna. Cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin-A supplementation given to all susceptible children in the affected village. IEC activities undertaken regarding providing proper nutrition and early treatment of cases.

Cases reported from Block Kolaras; 17 cases from Village Pahadi under SC Kudoniya and 19 cases from village/SC Sesai. Vaccination done among children 6 months to 5 yrs of age. Vitamin A supplement given to all susceptible children in the village. Health education given.

Cases with fever and rash reported from Villages Bhadekh and Aal under Block/PHC Kuthond. Cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin-A supplementation given to all susceptible children in the affected village. IEC activities undertaken regarding isolation and early treatment of cases.

Outbreak reported from Village: - Gargatu Shani SHC- Barai, Block Badarwas. Cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin-A supplementation given to all susceptible children in the affected village. IEC activities undertaken regarding providing proper nutrition and early treatment of cases.

Cases of fever with rash reported from village/Primary Health Centre Matanamadh under Block Abdasa Lkhpat. Cases of fever and rash reported from Village Pipalgabhan, PHC Sadakpore under Block Chikhli,. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 5 sera samples sent for lab examination to B.J. Medical College, Ahmedabad; result awaited. Outbreak of fever with maculopapular rash reported from RD Block, Kikruma. Out of 8 sera samples sent to RMRC Dibrugarh for lab confirmation, 6 reported positive for IgM ELISA for Measles antibodies. Health camp conducted to treat cases. Vitamin-A supplementation given to all susceptible children in the affected area. IEC activities undertaken regarding providing proper nutrition and isolation of cases.

Cases reported from Dathgaura, Block Palera. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Cases reported with fever with rash, cough, cold and conjunctivitis. All preventive measures taken and symptomatic treatment given to those affected. Vitamin-A supplementation given to affected children in the village.

Cases of fever and rash reported from Village Pipalgabhan, PHC Sadakpore under Block Chikhli. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Outbreak of fever with rash reported from Village Bhunad and its nearby areas under Block Kihar. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Cases reported from PHC Sanosara, Sub Center Jiyana. RCHO and team visited the affected area. 5 Serum samples collected and sent for investigation of measles. House to house surveillance done. Group discussion regarding measles done and other vaccine benefits to child done.

Cases clinically diagnosed as Measles were reported from Bondyachapada, under Mangrul subcentre, Parali PHC under Wada Block. A total of 12 cases reported from Village Janaki nagar,HSC Anjana,CHC/ District Pakur. Further 11 cases occurred till 8th week (week ending 23rd February). Cases of measles were reported from Village Garajiya, SC Dungarpur , PHC Gheti , Block Palitna, , District Bhavnaga. Cases were reported initially by PHC Medical Officer following which active survey was done to identify more cases of measles. As a result a total of 06 cases were identified. All the cases were unimmunized children between 2-5 years of age. 05 serum samples were collected and sent to Microbiology Department of Civil Hospital Ahmedabad for IgG & IgM serology; result awaited. Isolation of cases done and Vitamin A given to all affected children. Catch up immunization campaign was organized in the affected village to cover the unimmunized children. IEC was done regarding prevention of Measles.

Cases were reported from UHC Kanjari, Block Nadiad, District Kheda. District and Block RRT visited the area. Out of 10 cases 03 were males and 07were females. All children were under 10 years of age. All 05 serum samples collected tested positive for Measles by IgM Elisa. Vitamin A given to all cases. Active survey conducted.

Current Status: Cases reported from Block Raghunathpur-I, SC Kalapathar, Village Raidih, district Purulia. The total population of under 5 children in the area was 250. A total of 06 serum samples were tested for measles by Ig M ELISA and all found positive. There was poor vaccine coverage in the area and people were from low socio economic status. The deceased was a 9 month old child. All the cases were given Vit A prophylaxis.

Comments/ Action Taken: An outbreak of Measles with 05 cases was reported from Village Baishani, Block Kapkot, district Bageshwar in 21st week. A total of 05 serum samples sent to Medical college Haldwani out of which 03 were positive by IgM ELISA. IEC conducted and isolation of cases was done.

Cases reported from PHC Chhatapur, Block Soharwa, District Supaul. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Majority of the cases were below 06 years of age. Samples collected and sent by NPSP.All the cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin A given to all the cases. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Memarpur, SC Mallipur, PHC Purkhas, CHC Ganaur, District Sonepat. Cases present with fever and rash. Out of 05 serum samples collected and sent to SMS Lab Jaipur, for wear found positive for measles iGm ELISA District RRT investigated the outbreak. IEC was done regarding awareness of the disease in the form of group meetings. Immunization strengthened in the area.

Cases reported from Shahganj and Islam Nagar, District Agra. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 05 serum samples taken and sent to lab; result awaited. All the cases treated symptomatically,vitamin A given to all the children. Health education given.

Cases of fever with rash reported from Village Markadih, SC Dhurkot, PHC Nawagarh, District Janjgir. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A total of 05 serum samples sent; result awaited. One 07 year old male child died due to the condition. All the cases had history of immunization against Measles. Medical camp organized in the village and all the cases were treated symptomatically..

Cases of fever with rash reported from Village/PHC Kanoda Block Bechraji, District Mahesana. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active case search being done. out of 05 serum samples sent to BJMC Ahmedabad ,04 samples tested positive for measles and 01 sample tested positive for rubella.Majority of cases were between 6-10 year age group. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases of fever with rash reported from a Bhatta (brick kiln site ) in PHC Purkhas area, CHC Ganaur, District Jhajjar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given

Cases reported from Village Doloipara, PHCPaskiapara CHC Udalguri. District RRT

Outbreak reported from Bathangachi village, Bhurulia sub centre, Plassey-1 GP of Kaliganj Block. Block RRT visited the affected area. Medical camp held with medical officer and other staff. House to house survey done for cases with fever and rash. Blood samples collected and sent to ICMR virus unit of ID&BG Hospital. Isolation and treatment of cases advised.

All cases are children from Vijaypura village, PHC Relawan, Block Kishanganj, which is a tribal area (saharia tribe) with illiterate population and low vaccination coverage. Cases with fever and rash diagnosed clinically. House to house search done in the village by the medical team. Vaccination coverage survey done, and all unvaccinated children in the village given a dose of measles vaccine along with a dose of Vitamin A. Health education given regarding prophylactic measures.

Outbreak reported from Blocks Manathavady (19) and Kalpetta (15). Most of the cases are students in between the age of 5 and 12. Sample collected, House to house survey done. Group talk conducted, Health education classes conducted. Vitamin A given , immunization camps conducted, Medical camp conducted in the area and in schools.

Outbreak occurred in children less than five yrs old in villages Dhupnagar and Mushartok under PHC Dhobawal. Medical officers from Block and PHC visited the area undertook IEC activities and preventive measures. All cases treated symptomatically and immunization of all under-five children of the affected area done.

Cases reported from two blocks Mananthavady Block & Kalpetta Block. District RRT visited. Most of the cases are students in between the age of 5 and 14. Blood sample collected, sent to district laboratory for analysis; result awaited.. House to house survey done. Health education through group talks conducted, vitamin A given, Immunization camp conducted for all susceptible children, School health survey conducted in the area in schools.

Cases reported from Ward no. 3 Laxmi Nagla Kachchla, PHC Ujhani. Treatment provided by new PHC Kachchla. All cases treated and isolated. Active surveillance is being done to find new cases. Health education imparted to children regarding isolation of cases and hygienic practices.

Outbreak reported from neighboring villages of Loiliang, Barfu, Hayuliang, Whailiang, Roiliang, Nagaliang, Gamin, Gamliang, CHC Hayuliang. District Rapid Response Team (RRT) visited the affected areas. All cases were children under five years of age. Two sera samples sent to RMRC, Dibrugrah found positive for IgM Measles antibodies. Mass immunization and Vitamin-A prophylaxis given to all susceptible children.

Cases reported from Village Katanayakanahatty, PHC Nagasamudra. The airborne disease happened to vaccinationed children. It seems to be low immune status to these particular children because of lack of nutritions foods in their meals means malnutrition. District RRT visited the affected area. Two blood samples for serology sent to NICD, result awaiting. Distributed vitamin A supplements, symptomatic treatment given. Advised the parents to give proper rest and fluid to the effected children. Recommended isolation of the effected children. Instructed the health workers to monitor the cases to ruled out the complications. Advised the parents to contact the medical team if the children will have any respiratory trouble or to call the ambulance to taken the child in to the PHC. IEC activitiesdone, Pamphlets distributed, Health education given to the public and conducted measles awareness classes.

Cases reported from Village Prahladpur, Block Faizbag. All are children under five years of age. District RRT visited the area and immunization status is being assessed. Vitamin-A prophylaxis and immunization being undertaken for all susceptible children. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given to villagers regarding isolation and treatment of cases.

Cases reported from Kalpetta Block. Most of the cases are in the age-group of 5 -16 years. Sera samples collected and sent for investigation; result awaited. Local health workers visited the affected locality. IEC activities conducted and health education given regarding isolation and early treatment of cases. Vitamin A prophylaxis given to all susceptible children. Health workers monitoring the area on a daily basis.
